availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Boyd (Hancock County merchant and saloon owner)

body.p: A Georgia-born, Kentucky farmer and saloon owner. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Belle Boyd. Father of Henry Boyd, Elizabeth "Lizzie" Boyd, George Boyd, Buckner Boyd, Catherine Boyd, and Frank Boyd. Owned five enslaved persons in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 114; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 10; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville Town, p. 1.
